column4: Does anyone here know if a partition table can be changed from GPT to something that windows can recognize ?  My windows boot disk only sees the HDD as one partition even though it is 4 partitions.
dangerous stuff
I recommend backing up first
so is create a partition table that other OS's cant read.
not that I like windows at all, but why would ubuntu do this?
what is the fs?
I mean hell, even cfdisk cant read GTP.
fs right now is irrelevant as the XP installer (as well as vista) dont even see a single partition.  Just an unformatted drive
not familiar with that one.. like I said, back it up and format it accordingly
however I have ntfs, fat32, and ext3 partition
all those extentions are readable from within windows
ext3 requires a plugin though
IF  the windows installer (or windows) can even see a GPT
which it can not
what is GPT.. sorry ,don't recognize the accronym
its the partition table format that intrepid uses
k sorry
I stuck with ext3...
ext is a filesystem type, not a partition table
yes with you so far
so sticking with ext3 doesnt mean anything in this case.  thats not the issue.  the issue is the partition table itself can not be read.
sounds like you know more then me sir...
which really doesn't say alot though ;)
